snippet: The ruling is the clearest decision yet on whether prosecutors must turn over potentially exculpatory information to defendants during the plea process.
abstract: West Virginia Supreme Court allows withdrawal of 2002 guilty plea by Joseph A Buffey for rape and robbery after evidence withheld by prosecutors suggest he was innocent; case brings to forefront serious flaws in Brady rule where innocent people can be wrongly incarcerated.
lead_paragraph: The ruling is the clearest decision yet on whether prosecutors must turn over potentially exculpatory information to defendants during the plea process.

headline.main: West Virginia Ruling Could Clarify the Rights of Criminal Defendants
headline.print_headline: Court Ruling May Clarify the Rights of Suspects
